newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lankan man posing as woman sent to psychiatrist.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lankan man posing as woman sent to psychiatrist.

text.p: A Sri Lankan man, who posed as a woman and won an award for being the best female entrepreneur, was sent to hospital by a magistrate on Friday for psychiatric checks, court officials said.
They said the magistrate had ordered the 36-year-old Sattambige Sriyaratne to be sent to a doctor for a full report on his mental state.
"The magistrate has ordered that a report be obtained on the person's mental condition," a court official told Reuters.
Sriyaratne was represented by his lawyers in court.
He had posed as a woman for about three years, received bank loans amounting to 33 million rupees ($500,000) and ran a successful business exporting prawns, police said last week.
Sriyaratne received an award from a senior government minister after being selected as the female entrepreneur of the year for 1995, police said.
They said he was also legally married to a 29-year-old man.
